sentence: Technology stocks were narrowly underperforming most of the broader markets Monday, with shares of tech companies in the S&P 500 rising almost 0.6% this afternoon.

In company news, Harris Corp ( HRS ) climbed to a record high on Monday after the technology-services contractor raised its quarterly cash dividend by 6% over its previous distribution to $0.53 per share.
The increased dividend is payable Sept. 21 to shareholders of record on Sept. 9.
HRS shares were up just under 2% at $92.62 apiece, staying at its highest share price ever.
(+) KLAC, (+2.3%) Upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform at Cowen & Co, which also raised its price target for the stock by $1 to $80 a share.

(-) CRM, (-0.1%) RBC Capital Markets trims price target by $1 to $91 per share and reiterates Outperform rating ahead of software firm reporting quarterly financial results after Monday's market close.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
